Package project.DAO

Class AppointmentDAO

java.lang.Object
project.DAO.AppointmentDAO
public class AppointmentDAO extends Object
Handles the database interactions for Appointment objects.
Author:
Teksong Eap

  • Method Details

    • getUnusedAppointmentId

      public static int getUnusedAppointmentId() throws SQLException
      Retrieves an unused appointment ID from the database. This is the highest current ID plus one.
      Returns:
      an unused appointment ID
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • addAppointmentToDB

      public static boolean addAppointmentToDB(Appointment appointment) throws SQLException
      Adds a new appointment to the database. The method sets up a SQL PreparedStatement to execute the INSERT operation, and sets the parameters of the PreparedStatement using the provided Appointment object's data. The method then executes the SQL statement and checks the returned row count to determine whether the operation was successful.
      Parameters:
      appointment - the appointment to add to the database
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful (i.e., at least one row was affected); false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • updateAppointmentInDB

      public static boolean updateAppointmentInDB(Appointment appointment) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing appointment in the database. The method sets up a SQL PreparedStatement to execute the UPDATE operation, and sets the parameters of the PreparedStatement using the provided Appointment object's data. The method then executes the SQL statement and checks the returned row count to determine whether the operation was successful.
      Parameters:
      appointment - the appointment with updated information
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful (i.e., at least one row was affected); false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection

    • checkForOverlap

      public static boolean checkForOverlap(Appointment newAppointment) throws SQLException
      Checks whether a new or updated appointment overlaps with existing appointments for the same customer. The method sets up a SQL PreparedStatement to execute a SELECT operation that retrieves appointments for the same customer that overlap with the provided newAppointment's start and end times. If the ResultSet returned by the query is not empty, there is an overlapping appointment.
      Parameters:
      newAppointment - the new or updated appointment to check for overlap
      Returns:
      true if there is an overlapping appointment; false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection

    • getAllAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAllAppointments()
      Retrieves all appointments from the database.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all appointments in the database

    • getAllAppointmentsThisMonth

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAllAppointmentsThisMonth()
      Retrieves all appointments occurring in the current month from the database.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all appointments in the current month

    • getAllAppointmentsThisWeek

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAllAppointmentsThisWeek()
      Retrieves all appointments occurring in the current week from the database.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all appointments in the current week

    • getAppointmentsByContact

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAppointmentsByContact(int selectedContactId)
      Retrieves all appointments for a specific contact from the database.
      Parameters:
      selectedContactId - the ID of the contact whose appointments are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all appointments for the selected contact

    • getAppointmentCountByTypeAndMonth

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<TypeAndMonthReport> getAppointmentCountByTypeAndMonth()
      Retrieves a report from the database showing the number of appointments by type and month. The method executes a SQL SELECT operation that groups appointments by type and month, and uses the ResultSet to create TypeAndMonthReport objects and add them to an ObservableList.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing the report data

    • getUpcomingAppointment

      public static Appointment getUpcomingAppointment(int userId) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the upcoming appointment for a user from the database. The method executes a SQL SELECT operation that retrieves appointments for the specified user that start within the next 15 minutes. If such an appointment exists, the ResultSet is used to create an Appointment object, which is then returned.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose upcoming appointment is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the upcoming Appointment object for the user, or null if no upcoming appointment exists
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection

    • deleteAppointmentFromDB

      public static boolean deleteAppointmentFromDB(int selectedAppointmentId) throws SQLException
      Deletes an appointment from the database. The method sets up a SQL PreparedStatement to execute a DELETE operation, and sets the ID of the appointment to delete as the parameter of the PreparedStatement. The method then executes the SQL statement and checks the returned row count to determine whether the operation was successful.
      Parameters:
      selectedAppointmentId - the ID of the appointment to delete
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful (i.e., at least one row was affected); false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection
